Uses of Class
js.user.JsXMLHttpRequest

Packages that use JsXMLHttpRequest
js Opaque classes and interfaces necessary to simulate JavaScript features, and internal classes for simulative implementation. 
js.dom Opaque classes and interfaces simulating client-side DOM. 
js.user Opaque classes simulating client-side JavaScript objects. 
jsx.http Handles HTTP requests by using XMLHTTPRequest or ActiveX for IE. 
 

Uses of JsXMLHttpRequest in js

          Returns an instance of XMLHttpRequest in Java version.
protected abstract  JsXMLHttpRequest Sim.http()
          Returns an instance of XMLHttpRequest in Java version.

Methods in jsx.http with parameters of type JsXMLHttpRequest
static void Http.abort(JsXMLHttpRequest http)
          Cancels the current HTTP request, closing connections and stopping any pending network activity.

          Returns the HTTP response headers as an unparsed string.

          Returns the value of a named HTTP response header.

          Determines if the current HTTP request is loaded.
static boolean Http.isOpen(JsXMLHttpRequest http)
          Determines if the current HTTP request is open.

          Sets the onreadystatechange event handler of the current HTTP request to the specified function.

          Initializes HTTP request parameters, such as the URL and HTTP method, but does not send the request.

          Initializes HTTP request parameters, such as the URL and HTTP method, but does not send the request.

          Returns the readyState property of the current HTTP request.

static void Http.send(JsXMLHttpRequest http)
          Sends the HTTP request, using parameters passed to the Http.open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String) method and an optional request body passed to this method.

          Sends the HTTP request, using parameters passed to the Http.open(JsXMLHttpRequest, String, String, Boolean, String, String) method and an optional request body passed to this method.
static void Http.setRequestHeader(JsXMLHttpRequest http, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets or adds an HTTP request header to an open but unsent request.

          Returns the status property of the current HTTP request.
